definition: Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: More cars would not only bring traffic congestion, but also noise and parking problems.
sentences.chinese: 車輛增加不僅會造成塞車，也會製造噪音和停車問題。

sentences.english: No one likes getting stuck in a mile-long bottleneck on the freeway when you're going to work.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡在上班路上因塞車而苦苦等候。

sentences.english: Congestion and traffic pollution are growing problems on China’s roads as car ownership surges.
sentences.chinese: 因車輛購買狂潮導致道路擁擠和塞車問題日益嚴峻。

sentences.english: We'll be alright if there're no hold-ups.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有塞車，我們會沒問題的。

sentences.english: A:How can we avoid the jam?
sentences.chinese: 我們怎樣才能避免塞車？

sentences.english: No need to honk the horn under such a traffic block.
sentences.chinese: 在這種塞車的情況下，你再按喇叭也無濟於事。

sentences.english: The Bus driver is in a Bad temper because he's been driving all day in traffic.
sentences.chinese: 公車司機因在塞車陣中開了整天的車而脾氣不好。

sentences.english: When seeing our heavy traffic jam at home, I really want to know why this rarely happens in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 看到國內動輒大塞車，很想知道日本咋回事。

sentences.english: We can go this way to avoid a traffic jam.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以走這條路以避免塞車。

sentences.english: On the way back to moscow.
sentences.chinese: 返回莫斯科市的路上大塞車。

sentences.english: B:I notice there's a jam a few blocks away.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到前幾個街口正塞車。

sentences.english: We have to shunpike there's a tailback in the city.
sentences.chinese: 現在城裏正在塞車排長隊，我們得繞路而行了。

sentences.english: How can we avoid the traffic jam?
If a truck breaks down it can often lead to jams of several days.
sentences.chinese: 如果一輛卡車拋錨了，通常會引起長達好幾天的塞車。

sentences.english: Such"phantom jams" occur when there is no obvious obstruction.
sentences.chinese: 這種非阻礙物引起的堵車叫做“幽靈塞車”。

sentences.english: Mom, Dad says he was the traffic jam.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽，爸爸說他遇上塞車了。

definition: to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
light rail/transit system (underground, at street level or elevated)/streetcar/metro/abbr. for 輕型軌道交通|轻型轨道交通[qing1 xing2 gui3 dao4 jiao1 tong1]
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
saving/to save/to use sparingly/to cut down on
